emerging_technologies.name: AI-Driven Smart Contracts
emerging_technologies.description: Smart contracts that adapt to real-time data and user interactions through AI.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Enhances contract efficiency, reduces human error, and potentially increases trust in automated systems.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Requires standardization, legal frameworks, and AI ethics considerations.

emerging_technologies.name: Decentralized Autonomous Transport Networks
emerging_technologies.description: A network of self-regulating, blockchain-verified transport systems optimizing routes and resource allocation.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Could lead to reduced traffic congestion, lower emissions, and improved public transport systems.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Needs widespread IoT adoption, regulatory approval, and public trust in autonomous systems.

emerging_technologies.name: Neural Identity Tokens
emerging_technologies.description: Tokenization of personal neural data for identity verification and cognitive enhancement trading.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Raises concerns about privacy, data security, and the potential commodification of personal identity.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Requires significant advancements in neural interface technology, regulatory acceptance, and public education on data rights.

emerging_technologies.name: Space Resource Tokenization
emerging_technologies.description: Tokenizing space resources like minerals or water ice to facilitate their trade and ownership.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Could spur space industry growth but also poses questions about space law and ownership rights.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Dependent on space travel advancements, legal frameworks for space commerce, and international cooperation.

mainstream_technologies.name: Tokenized Energy Markets
mainstream_technologies.description: Systems where energy production and consumption are tokenized, allowing for a decentralized energy market.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: High adoption in regions with renewable energy focus; regulatory challenges persist in others.

mainstream_technologies.name: Decentralized Grid Management
mainstream_technologies.description: Utilizes blockchain for grid management, enabling peer-to-peer energy trading and dynamic load balancing.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Gaining traction due to demand for resilient and flexible energy distribution systems.

epoch_themes.description: A shift towards systems that operate autonomously and with decentralized control, reducing reliance on centralized governance.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Promotes resilience, privacy, and efficiency but challenges existing governance models.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Increased push for data sovereignty, local governance, and autonomous systems in various sectors.

epoch_themes.description: The trend of representing physical or digital assets as tokens on blockchain platforms for trading or management.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Creates new economic models, potentially democratizing access to resources but also raising issues of inequality and security.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Expansion of digital economies, growth of cryptocurrency markets, and increasing interest in fractional ownership.
